PRINCIPLE DESIGNER / OWNER
Professional Summary
Interior Designer with a distinct understanding of spatial theory who harbors an exceptional design instinct and is uniquely attuned to the importance of materiality, lighting, composition and the overall design process.
Core Qualifications
Drafting
Space planning
Interior architectural detailing Color and material application
Proficient with furniture systems
Concept development
Proficient in AutoCAD Graphic presentations Product specifications

SKILLS

3D, Approach, Art, AGENCY, AutoCAD, Basic, budgets, budget, Color, Concept, Concept development, content, Council, client, clients, direction, documentation, Drafting, fast, floor plans, Graphic, HVAC, Instructor, interior
design, Interior Design, Lighting, access, Window, Plumbing, presentations, Design Process, Space planning, specification, Teaching, vision, written

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

Lighting Designer and Project Manager for David A Mintz Inc., a former May Company consulting firm.
Developed and designed all lighting for Robinson — May , Fashion Valley Mall and Foley's, Scottsdale Fashion Square Mall.
Assisted in the development and design of various Hecht's, Kaufmann's, Strawbridge's, and Lord and Taylor department store lighting, while simultaneously completing and meeting all deadlines for several large-scale successful projects.
Successfully completing graduate school by I writing thesis underlining the theoretical concept of spatial theory.

EXPERIENCE

Principle Designer / Owner
Company Name
— City , State
Designed floor plans, elevations, and 3D perspective views and material boards for both in-house review and presentation to the client.
Programmed client's need from schematic design to the construction document phase and installation.
Created professional presentations to creatively communicate design intent and direction.
Participated in furniture selection and documentation of the specifications.
Maintained accurate specifications for each project.
Ensured that the project vision and design intent were reflected.
Visited home sites when necessary to assess and fulfill customer needs.
Successfully assisted clients in choosing furnishings that were consistent with their preferences and budget.
Produced content for material boards and specification binders for presentation and construction.
Reviewed project costs, budgets and adherence to schedules.

Electrical (Power & Lighting), Plumbing, Sprinklers. and some HVAC.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Miller

Location: Columbia, SC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
SIGN-ON BONUS**** Under broad-general work direction, is responsible for providing the pasta manufacturing operation with the blend of semolina that consistently meets with American Italian Pasta Co, a Winland Foods, Inc, specifications through continuous monitoring of incoming wheat quality (raw materials) and mastery of the milling process. 

Employee Type:

Full time

Location:

SC Columbia

Job Type:

Production Operations

Job Posting Title:

Miller

Job Description:

Responsibilities:

Responsible for providing general direction of day-to-day activities in order to meet the schedule and production requirement of shift operations. Determines on a daily basis (or as-needed) basis which blends of wheat are necessary for producing the specified quality semolina. Oversees the milling process and utilization of the computerized system to ensure designated quality levels of “finished” products. Directs blends of semolina and clear flours to pasta operations or load-out facility. Also directs finished feed and binning feed into designated load-out bins. Sends samples of each of the previously mentioned processes to the laboratory for analysis; subsequently uses results for making appropriate adjustments to the milling process. Completes mill production, inventory and quality reports on a routine basis. Initiates necessary interaction with other department personnel in order to keep mill operating at optimum performance levels. Participants in performance of regular preventative maintenance activities to ensure peak mill performance. Directs Mill Operator in performance of necessary operational duties. Manage safety performance of the Mill Operator on shift. Responsible for the production of quality, safe and legal product. Other related duties as assigned by the Head Miller or Mill Manager. Contribute to the safe work environment for fellow employees and comply with all safety policies and procedures. 

Supervision:

Mill Manager. 

Qualifications/Education/Experience/Skills:

Milling skills and knowledge gained through technical school training, completion of a four-year milling science college program and/or actual milling experience is essential. Included is the ability to utilize computerized data and laboratory results to independently make decisions relative to the necessary adjustments that must be made in order to produce the desired quality of mill products.

A reasonably high level of communication skills is necessary for purposes of interacting with various departments and levels of employees and management within the company. Tasks performed involve work with equipment, materials and/or procedure that require familiarity with formal safety procedures and the following of these procedures in order maintain the safety of the work environment. The employee is required to stand and walk 90 percent of the shift; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms. The position requires climbing or balancing on a frequent basis. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Periodically the employee must lift 100 pounds. Vision requirements include near and far visual acuity with some degree of color perception.

Work Environment:

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently exposed to moving mechanical parts. The noise level in the work environment is generally in the 70 – 80 decibel range. Temperatures will reach high levels in the work environment.

Must possess good oral and written communication skills as well as basic math skills. Must be able to interact with all plant personnel.

Must be organized and detail oriented. Should be familiar with Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP), HACCP, basic OSHA safety regulations and possess a minimum of 6 months experience in a food manufacturing facility. Must be able to lift a minimum of 50 pounds and to work at high elevations, in confined areas, in extreme heat and cold and in outside conditions on a regular basis. Must be able to navigate numerous flights of stairs/ladders on a continual basis. Must possess the ability to use a variety of hand tools such as scrapers, air hose, ladders, wrenches, screwdrivers, etc. Must be able to work independently and as part of a team. 

EEO Statement:

Winland Foods believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit develop, and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. Winland Foods is committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
